p: The promising efficacy of C. mas in the modulation of blood glucose, as well as lipid parameters, in alloxan diabetic rats was reported. A plausible mechanism is the inhibition of Î±-glucosidase by the acylated anthocyanins found richly in the fruit. Oleanolic acid is a triterpenoid considered to be part of the observed effect, acting by reducing glucose absorption and enhancing the release of acetylcholine from nerve terminals at muscarinic M3 receptors in the pancreatic cells, and it also augments insulin release [ 208].
